greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of Dyck paths of semilength n having k occurrences of the string ududu, where u=(1,1), d=(1,-1).
comment: Sum of entries in row n is the Catalan number A000108(n).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..150, flattened
Toufik Mansour, Statistics on Dyck Paths, Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 9 (2006), Article 06.1.5.
formula: G.f.:  C(z*(1-t*z-z^2+t*z^2)/(1-t*z-z^3+t*z^3)), where C(u) = (1-sqrt(1-4*u))/(2*u) is the Catalan function. See Corollary 2.2 in the Mansour reference.
example: Row 4 is 11, 2, 1; indeed in the 14 Dyck paths of semilength 4 ududu occurs only once in ududuudd, once in uudududd, and twice in udududud.
maple: C := proc (u) options operator, arrow: (1/2-(1/2)*sqrt(1-4*u))/u end proc: G := C(z*(1-t*z-z^2+t*z^2)/(1-t*z-z^3+t*z^3)): Gser := simplify(series(G, z = 0, 20)): T := proc (n, k) options operator, arrow: coeff(coeff(Gser, z, n), t, k) end proc: 1; 1; for n from 2 to 12 do seq(T(n, k), k = 0 .. n-2) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form
b:= proc(x, y, t) option remember; `if`(y<0 or y>x, 0,
mathematica: b[x_, y_, t_] := b[x, y, t] = If[y<0 || y>x, 0, If[x == 0, 1, Expand[b[x-1, y+1, {2, 2, 4, 2, 4}[[t]] ]*If[t == 5, z, 1] + b[x-1, y-1, {1, 3, 1, 5, 1}[[t]] ]]]]; T[n_] := Function[{p}, Table[Coefficient[p, z, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, z]}]][b[2*n, 0, 1]];Table[T[n], {n, 0, 15}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 27 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Sep 10 2014
